DataElement.preferredName: Background Tissue Standardized Uptake Value Anatomic Site Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the location of an organ or structure within the body that is similar to that of the tumor location, in order to perform a standard uptake value (SUV) measurement on background tissue(s). [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Background Tissue Standardized Uptake Value Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Existing conditions, especially those that would be confused with the phenomenon to be observed or measured._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) 1[injected dose (nCi) 1 body weight (g)]._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Existing conditions, especially those that would be confused with the phenomenon to be observed or measured.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Concepts.definition: Existing conditions, especially those that would be confused with the phenomenon to be observed or measured.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Property.preferredDefinition: An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) 1[injected dose (nCi) 1 body weight (g)].:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: An effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)].
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the text field to describe the position of an organ or structure within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support U Washington adoption of C3D for FES trial.
